revised_title: Extraordinary Sea Agitation and Epidemic Disorder in Barbados
tldr: Mr. Abraham Mason reports an extraordinary agitation of the sea in Barbados, similar to a Lisbon earthquake, and an epidemic disorder affecting the island's inhabitants. The sea agitation lasted for three hours, with an ebb and flow of 18 inches to 2 feet. The island experienced a severe cold, and the epidemic affected almost all inhabitants, causing distress and impacting the health of the British Royal Navy ships in the region.
